posts.title: Walter Benjamin on History, Collections, & Archives
posts.text: “There is no document of civilization which is not at the same time a document of barbarism.” — Walter Benjamin

posts.title: Spanish Harlem’s Contribution to Jazz
posts.text: Strolling through East Harlem, one can still find visual references to Latin jazz legends of the past.

posts.title: East Harlem Stories
posts.text: Home to successive waves of immigrants over the centuries, the neighborhood today percolates with the cultural energy brought by Puerto Ricans in the 20th century, and from more recent diasporas.

posts.title: The Poetry of W.S. Merwin
posts.text: A member of the 2019 NYPL Best Poetry Books Committee recalls the work of the late W.S. Merwin, a social poet who shied away from the public square, whose poetry posed something of a puzzle.

posts.title: 150 Years of The Washington Heights Library: A Brief History
posts.text: In anticipation of this weekend's open house, here's how library service started and evolved in the Washington Heights community.
